resources.string: Enjoying prime location in the centre of Warsaw, Hampton by Hilton Warsaw City Centre is within a few steps of Warszawa Centralna Train Station, Złote Tarasy Shopping Centre and Palace of Culture and Science. It offers air conditioned accommodation with free broadband WiFi and access to a modern gym.
Price from 400 zł per person per night

This property is 6 minutes walk from the beach. Surrounded by greenery and with a spacious garden, the Hostel Wisełka features outdoor barbecue facilities and free on-site parking. Its bright rooms come with free Wi-Fi and a private bathroom. Ready breakfast sets are served every morning in the hostel’s dining room. A vending machine with drinks is available. All rooms at the Wisełka are decorated with wooden features and come with a working space. Each has a shower and a TV.
Wał Miedzeszyński 391, Praga Poludnie, 03-975 Warsaw, Poland

Offering panoramic views of Warsaw, the modern-looking Novotel Warszawa Centrum is located in central Warsaw, a 5-minute walk from the Central Railway Station. The hotel serves a varied breakfast. WiFi is offered throughout this 4-star hotel. All areas are non-smoking. The air conditioned rooms at Novotel Warszawa Centrum come with a flat-screen TV, tea and coffee facilities, and a safe. There is a minibar at a surcharge.The rooms also have a work area and armchairs or a sofa. All feature a spacious bathroom with a bath or a shower and a hairdryer.
Price from 300 zł per person per night

Radisson Blu Sobieski is a luxurious, non-smoking hotel in the centre of Warsaw. It offers elegant rooms, excellent cuisine and leisure facilities. Free Wi-Fi is available. This 4-star property features well air-conditioned rooms with soundproofing, an LCD satellite TV and a minibar. The apartments also have a living room with a sofa and a work desk. The private bathroom comes with a shower or a bath.
Price from 200 zł per person per night
Plac Artura Zawiszy 1, Ochota, 02-025 Warsaw, Poland

Cloud Hostel is located in the heart of historic Praga district, right next to tram turning loop that allows for a quick transport to the Old Town of Warsaw. It offers modern rooms and dormitories with free Wi-Fi. Every room in Cloud Hostel is painted in lively, bright colours has a shared bathroom. Each dormitory room has lockers.
Free parking Free WiFi Airport shuttle Non-smoking rooms 24-hour front desk Room service
Price from 100 zł per person per night
ul. Otwocka 1, Praga Pólnoc, 03-759 Warsaw, Poland

The original menu at Platter reflects Karol Ocrasa\'s passion for creating fresh and healthy Polish cuisine, enriched with international accents. All ingredients are natural, each taste is authentic and each element of the menu comes straight from the heart.
Located in a building with a long history of good cuisine since the 1950’s the Stary Dom Restaurant offers regional food and quite a selection of Polish spirits, vodkas and wines.
Passion and nature put together. On the plates there is no place for boredom, there is colorful and tasty but also modern.
The Old Polish cuisine offers an abundance of tastes and aromas, unforgettable duets of wine and food that bring out the savory sauces, herbs and spices.
Great food, friendly staff and atmosphere.
The Neon Muzeum is dedicated to the documentation and the preservation of Cold War era neon signs.
Czar PRL - life under communism museum

The “Charm of the PRL” Museum allows younger generations to get to know the past of their parents, while the older ones will be able to remember the brighter and darker sides of the People’s Republic of Poland (PRL).
The Zachęta collection consists of more than 3500 items (paintings, sculptures, installations, videos, works on paper) as well as reflecting a rich history that has impacted on its diversity.

The National Museum in Warsaw was originally founded in 1862 as the Museum of Fine Arts and is currently one of the oldest art museums in the country. After Poland regained its independence in 1918, the National Museum was ascribed a prominent role in the plans for the new state and its capital city of Warsaw, and the Modernist building in which it currently resides was erected in 1927–1938.
Museum of the History of Polish Jews
The idea to create a Museum of the History of Polish Jews emerged at the Association of the Jewish Historical Institute. This idea soon secured support both in Poland and abroad.
The Royal Łazienki was King Stanisław August’s summer residence, in which a classicist architecture is harmoniously blended with its natural surroundings featuring fabulous gardens.

During the Warsaw Uprising in August 1944, more than 85% of Warsaw\'s historic centre was destroyed by Nazi troops. After the war, a five-year reconstruction campaign by its citizens resulted in today\'s meticulous restoration of the Old Town, with its churches, palaces and market-place. It is an outstanding example of a near-total reconstruction of a span of history covering the 13th to the 20th century.

National Stadium (Polish: Stadion Narodowy) is a retractable roof football stadium located in Warsaw, Poland. It is used mostly for football matches and it is the home stadium of Poland national football team.
al. Księcia J. Poniatowskiego 1, Warszawa 03-901, Polska
The most popular church near the Old Town. Beautiful history and great icons inside.

Historic cemetery located in the Wola district, western part of Warsaw. It is the most famous cemetery in the city, and one of the oldest, having been established in 1790. The necropolis features graves of many illustrious individuals from Polish history, including those interred along the "Avenue of Notables" (Aleja Zasłużonych) created in 1925. It estimated that over 1 million people have been buried at Powązki.

Room 13 is the heart of the legendary club Street Mazowiecka. Perfect location in the center of Warsaw, modern interiors combined with historic architecture and top-class music - all these qualities make Room 13 the best choice on the Warsaw's club map. The club is located in the original 19th century tenement house, located in the very center of Warsaw.
Club in center of Warsaw. 2 levels of awesome dancefloors and chillout rooms three bars and great, experience bartenders. Electronic music, such as house, tech house, deep house and techno.
One of the newest places in Warsaw club environment. Plenty of special items, such as red carpet and diamond chandelier.

Each day team of bartenders explore available seasonal products to bring the most natural experience of drinking a cocktail or infused vodka. We believe that limitations coming from working only with natural products brings more creativity than taking the easy way.
